item.title: 美国关税引发亚洲股市下跌：市场综述
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）承诺在数小时内对贸易伙伴征收关税，使美股创下今年最大跌幅，并引发了贸易战打击全球经济增长的担忧，亚洲股市将因此下跌。【原文：Asian stocks are set to fall as Donald Trump’s pledge to impose tariffs on trading partners within hours sent US shares to their biggest loss of the year and raised the spectre of a trade war hitting global economic growth.】

item.title: 日本小型股基金以鲜有分析师涉足的股票在竞争对手中拔得头筹
item.description: 日本持续的并购热潮帮助一家专注于股票分析师很少关注的公司的小型股基金在今年获得了超额回报。【原文：Japan’s ongoing boom in mergers and acquisitions is helping to generate superior returns this year for a small-cap fund that focuses on companies that few equity analysts cover.】

item.title: B.莱利公司持续经营亏损，收购努力结束
item.description: B.Riley Financial Inc. 公布了第四季度持续经营业务的初步亏损，这家经纪和投资公司正试图从受损的投资中反弹。【原文：B. Riley Financial Inc. posted a preliminary fourth-quarter loss from continuing operations as the brokerage and investment firm seeks to rebound from soured investments.】

item.title: 法国 Altice 债权人不满，请顾问改善条款
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Altice France SA 的一批有担保债权人对该公司与大多数债权人达成的削减约 86 亿欧元（约合 90 亿美元）债务的协议感到不满，他们已委托顾问寻找改善条件的方法。【原文：A group of secured creditors of Altice France SA, unhappy with the deal arranged between the company and a majority of its creditors to cut about €8.6 billion ($9 billion) of debt, have tapped advisers to find ways to improve their terms, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英伟达支持的 CoreWeave 提交 IPO 申请，披露收入增长情况
item.description: 作为人工智能领域最炙手可热的初创企业之一，云计算供应商 CoreWeave 提交了首次公开募股申请，并披露了快速增长的收入。【原文：CoreWeave, a cloud-computing provider that’s one of the hottest startups in artificial intelligence, filed for an initial public offering disclosing rapidly growing revenue.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚利用 Facebook、Tinder 和 Airbnb 应用程序进行性贩运
item.description:
更好的互联网服务、美国应用程序的普及以及大量游客的涌入为哥伦比亚未成年人遭受剥削提供了便利

。【原文：

Better internet service, the proliferation of US apps and an influx of tourists have converged to facilitate the exploitation of minors in Colombia

】

item.title: 7-Eleven 的浪费时间行为并不那么方便
item.description:
日本零售巨头正在避免与其加拿大崇拜者发生冲突。它应该正面应对这一威胁。【原文：

The Japanese retail giant is avoiding confrontation with its Canadian admirer. It should tackle the threat head-on. 

】

item.title: 前证监会律师称，宽松的私人融资规则有可能扼杀 IPO
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会的一位前律师表示，放宽监管本应促进美国首次公开募股市场的复兴，但这反而可能导致公司放弃首次公开募股，转而寻求私人融资。【原文：Lighter regulation was supposed to spur the revival of the US initial public offering market — instead, it may lead to companies eschewing IPOs and pursuing private funding, according to a former lawyer at the US Securities and Exchange Commission.】

item.title: 高盛集团史蒂夫-巴里（Steve Barry）在任职 26 年后将退休
item.description: 史蒂夫-巴里（Steve Barry）是高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Steve Barry, chief investment officer of fundamental equity at Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s asset management business, is set to retire after a 26-year run at the firm.】

item.title: 香港 3,530 亿美元保证金贷款热潮带来巨大收益和风险
item.description: 这笔钱足以收购阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司，或支付每位香港居民近 50,000 美元。【原文：It’s enough money to buy Alibaba Group Holding Ltd., or pay every resident of Hong Kong nearly $50,000.】

item.title: 诉讼称 TikTok 预计 TikTok Live 销售额达 770 亿美元
item.description: 根据一项新近在华盛顿提起的针对 TikTok 的诉讼，TikTok 在 2023 年的一个季度就通过 TikTok Live 创造了 17 亿美元的全球销售额，其中超过 4 亿美元来自美国。诉状称，TikTok 预计到 2027 年，这一流行的直播功能将在全球产生 770 亿美元的收入。【原文：TikTok generated $1.7 billion globally in sales from TikTok Live in just one quarter in 2023, with more than $400 million of that coming from the US, according to a newly unsealed lawsuit brought against the company in Washington. TikTok projects that the popular livestreaming feature will generate $77 billion globally by 2027, the complaint claims.】

item.title: 波多黎各公用事业破产焦点转向收入纠纷
item.description: 波多黎各破产电力公司和债权人正在接受指示，在就近 90 亿美元债务的重组方案进行辩论之前，解决有关该机构收入的问题。【原文：Puerto Rico’s bankrupt electric utility and creditors are being directed to resolve questions about the agency’s revenue before debating a proposal to restructure nearly $9 billion of debt.】

item.title: 加拿大外长表示加拿大已准备好对美国关税进行报复
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普证实其政府将于周二对加拿大和墨西哥征收关税后，加拿大外交部长表示，加拿大已准备好对美国制造的产品征收一揽子反关税措施。【原文：Canada has prepared a sweeping package of counter-tariffs against US-made products, its foreign minister said, after President Donald Trump confirmed his administration will go ahead with duties against Canada and Mexico on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特朗普确认即将征收关税，加拿大和墨西哥货币下跌
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统确认将于周二开始对来自这两个国家的产品征收 25% 的关税后，加元和墨西哥比索大幅下跌。【原文：The Canadian dollar and Mexican peso slumped after President Donald Trump confirmed 25% tariffs on products from both nations will begin Tuesday.】

item.title: 比亚迪扩大香港股票出售规模，融资 56 亿美元
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国电动汽车制造商比亚迪股份有限公司（BYD Co. Ltd.，以下简称 "比亚迪"）在出售的股票数量比原计划多出 10%之后，已筹集到 435 亿港元（约合 56 亿美元）的资金，这是香港近四年来最大的一次股票出售。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle maker BYD Co. has raised HK$43.5 billion ($5.6 billion) after selling 10% more shares than planned, according to people familiar with the matter, in Hong Kong’s biggest share sale in nearly four years.】

item.title: 巴利亚斯尼在动荡的二月实现增长，居千禧年和 Citadel 之首
item.description: 由于关税威胁和对经济的担忧震动了市场，巴利亚斯尼资产管理公司（Balyasny Asset Management LP）成为 2 月份全球最大的多管理人对冲基金中涨幅最大的公司。【原文：Balyasny Asset Management LP gained the most among the world’s biggest multimanager hedge funds in February as tariff threats and bubbling economic concerns shook markets.】

item.title: 利比亚启动内战以来首次石油勘探招标
item.description: 利比亚启动了自 2011 年内战前以来的首次能源勘探招标，在经历了多年的政治动荡和停产之后，这个欧佩克成员国正努力吸引石油和天然气巨头重返利比亚。【原文：Libya launched its first tender for energy exploration since before the 2011 civil war, as the OPEC member seeks to lure back oil and gas majors following years of political instability and production shutdowns.】

item.title: 美国芯片法案办公室因特朗普大清洗损失五分之二员工
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，随着唐纳德-特朗普总统削减联邦工作人员，负责一项价值 520 亿美元的芯片补贴计划的美国政府办公室将失去约五分之二的工作人员。【原文：The US government office responsible for a marquee $52 billion chip subsidy program will lose about two-fifths of its staff as President Donald Trump slashes the federal workforce, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 顶级航母警告：美国对中国船只收费可能导致成本激增
item.description: 全球最大远洋运输公司的负责人警告说，如果美国对中国建造的船只和拥有这些船只的公司征收费用，可能会使集装箱运价上涨 25%。【原文：The head of the world’s biggest ocean carrier warned that proposed US fees on Chinese-built ships and the companies that own them could raise container rates by 25% if imposed.】

item.title: 加拿大东海岸搁浅船只上的危险货物已获救
item.description: 据管理该船的公司称，上个月在加拿大搁浅的一艘船上的危险货物和燃料已经得到控制。【原文：The hazardous cargo and fuel on a ship that ran aground in Canada last month has been contained, according to the company that manages the vessel.】

item.title: 富时罗素允许欧元和美元股票加入英国指数
item.description: 指数提供商富时罗素（FTSE Russell）将允许以欧元和美元交易的股票加入英国的主要基准，此举有助于吸引股票在伦敦上市。【原文：Index provider FTSE Russell will let stocks that trade in euros and US dollars join major UK benchmarks, in a move that could help attract listings to London.】

item.title: 特朗普称将于 4 月 2 日开始对农产品进口征收关税
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统表示，美国将从 4 月 2 日起对 "外部 "农产品征收关税，这是他对进口商品设置贸易壁垒的最新威胁。【原文：President Donald Trump said the US would impose tariffs on “external” agricultural products starting on April 2, his latest threat to impose trade barriers on imported goods.】

item.title: 特朗普调查外国进口木材，木材价格创 2022 年新高
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统下令对运往美国的木材进行调查后，木材期货升至两年半以来的最高点。【原文：Lumber futures rose to the highest in more than two and a half years after President Donald Trump ordered an investigation into shipments of the commodity into the US.】

item.title: 欧佩克+将在特朗普压力下开始拖延已久的增加供应行动
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）要求降低油价的压力下，"欧佩克+"（OPEC+）在一再推迟后将继续执行恢复石油停产的计划。原油跌幅扩大。【原文：OPEC+ will proceed with plans to revive halted oil production after repeated delays, amid pressure from President Donald Trump to lower oil prices. Crude extended losses.】

item.title: 特朗普关税临近，美国汽车制造商面临信贷压力
item.description: 债券投资者越来越担心汽车制造商的前景，因为美国关税可能会打击他们的底线。【原文：Bond investors are getting a little more concerned about the outlook for automakers that could see their bottom lines hit by US tariffs.】

item.title: 费森尤斯寻求 11 亿欧元收购透析公司股份
item.description: 费森尤斯公司正在寻求通过出售费森尤斯医疗用品公司（Fresenius Medical Care AG）的股票以及与这家透析公司相关的可交换债券筹集约 11 亿欧元（12 亿美元）的资金，以削减债务并重新分配资本。【原文：Fresenius SE is seeking to raise about €1.1 billion ($1.2 billion) in a sale of shares in Fresenius Medical Care AG as well as exchangeable bonds linked to the dialysis firm, as it looks to cut debt and reallocate capital.】

item.title: 风险偏好助推债券市场迎来 2020 年以来最好的二月
item.description: 2 月份，市政债券市场表现异常强劲，但随着新债券销售的增加，该资产类别正面临逆风。【原文：The muni market notched an unusually strong month in February — but the asset class is facing headwinds as new bond sales build.】

item.title: 调查显示：银行家认为欧洲首次公开募股在缓慢起步后正在加速
item.description: 根据 IPO 咨询公司 Queens Lane 对股权资本市场银行家的调查，欧洲的首次公开募股市场在缓慢起步后，有望在德国上市的带动下于今年晚些时候加速发展。【原文：Europe’s initial public offering market is expected to accelerate later in the year after a slow start, led by German listings, according to survey of equity capital market bankers by IPO advisory firm Queens Lane.】

item.title: 穆萨莱姆称美联储目标冲突时通胀预期是关键
item.description: 圣路易斯联邦储备银行行长阿尔贝托-穆萨莱姆说，虽然他预计物价增长将朝着央行2%的目标放缓，但决策者必须控制通胀预期。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President Alberto Musalem said that while he anticipates price growth to moderate toward the central bank’s 2% goal, it is vital for policymakers to keep inflation expectations in check.】

item.title: 欧盟就银行交易规则进行民意调查，提供调整规则的选项
item.description: 据彭博新闻社看到的一份文件显示，欧盟计划就银行交易业务监管改革进行的民意调查将列出各种方案，包括提供长达三年的优惠。【原文：The European Union’s planned poll about regulatory changes for banks’ trading businesses will outline various options including offering concessions for as much as three years, according to a document seen by Bloomberg News.】
